articles.title: National Meeting Held
articles.content:
National Meeting Held
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Tuesday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Attending it were senior party, army and state officials, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media. Also present were bereaved families of revolutionary martyrs, persons of merit, working people in the city of Pyongyang, congratulatory groups of overseas compatriots, overseas Koreans and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 A report was delivered by Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly. 
					
					 He said that the birth of Kim Jong Il in Mt. Paektu, sacred mountain of the revolution, was the greatest fortune of the Korean nation that promised the rosy future of the revolutionary cause of Juche. It was also a world historic event that opened the bright future of the human cause of independence, he added.
					
					 Thanks to this auspicious birthday of Kim Jong Il, great man born of Heaven, the Korean people could demonstrate the dignity and honor of Kim Il Sung's nation which steers the era of independence in the grim tempest of history and advance to victory the revolutionary cause of Juche, blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation, he said, and went on:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK are shedding rays as President Kim Il Sung's party and state and have achieved the single-minded unity in which the army and people are rallied close around the party. This helped remarkably strengthen the driving force of the revolution and firmly consolidate the politico-ideological position. This is the precious fruition of Kim Jong Il's distinguished political caliber. 
					
					 The reporter underlined the need for all the party members, service personnel and other people to remain loyal to the monolithic leadership of Kim Jong Il and thoroughly implement the behests of Kim Il Sung, thus build a great prosperous and powerful nation in all fields, bring earlier the national reunification and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 The treacherous and anti-reunification moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen on the part of the south Korean authorities which stand against the improvement of the relations between the north and the south of Korea and totally deny the dialogue can never be tolerated, he stressed.
					
					 The reporter said that the DPRK would as ever develop the friendly and cooperative relations with those countries friendly toward it in the idea of independence, peace and friendship and positively contribute to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Similar events took place in provinces, cities and counties on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations from Russian Party Leader
articles.content:
Congratulations from Russian Party Leader
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory card and a gift from the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia on the occasion of his birthday.
					 Chairwoman S. Z. Umalatova handed them over to Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, on Feb. 11.

articles.title: Congratulations from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Congratulations from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of his birthday.
					 They were handed over to an official concerned by Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy who is doyen of the corps, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Reception Given for Military Attaches Corps Here
articles.content:
Reception Given for Military Attaches Corps Here
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of the People's Armed Forces hosted a reception for the military attaches corps here on Tuesday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the corps headed by Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy.
					
					 Minister Kim Yong Chun, Vice-Minister Pak Jae Gyong and generals and other officers of the Korean People's Army were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Int'l Foundation
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Int'l Foundation
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, on his birthday.
					 It was handed over to an official concerned on Tuesday.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the delegation of the Secretariat of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The basket was handed over to an official concerned by Secretary General of the Secretariat Masaharu Ueki on Tuesday.

articles.title: Paektusan Prize Int'l Figure-skating Festival Opens
articles.content:
Paektusan Prize Int'l Figure-skating Festival Opens
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The 20th Paektusan Prize International Figure-skating Festival opened here on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The festival brought together figure skaters of the DPRK, Russia, France and the Czech Republic.
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Ice Rink on Tuesday
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Sok Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and others. 
					
					 Congratulatory groups of overseas Koreans, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and foreign guests were on hand. 
					
					  Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, in an opening address said that this festival would mark a significant occasion in developing the unity, cooperation and sports technique among sports persons.
					
					 An opening performance was given by Korean figure skaters.
					
					 The performers successfully represented the high pride and self-respect of the Korean nation holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem and the Korean people's steadfast will to build a thriving socialist nation at an early date true to his leadership. 
					
					 The ceremony was followed by demonstration presentations.

articles.title: Demonstration Performance of Synchronized Swimming
articles.content:
Demonstration Performance of Synchronized Swimming
						
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- A demonstration performance of synchronized swimming "Eternal Spring in February" took place in the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex on Tuesday in celebration of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Among the spectators were Ri Thae Nam, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials concerned and working people in the city of Pyongyang. 
					
					 Present on invitation were congratulatory groups of overseas compatriots and Koreans from overseas and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and foreign guests. 
					
					 Amid the playing of the music "Confetti of Best Wishes" the performers depicted a large basket with plastic Kimjongilias on the surface.
					
					 In "Let's Sing of Our Pride in Being under the Guidance of the General", "General, Do Not Walk on Snow-covered Roads" and other numbers they represented their ardent longing and profound trust in Kim Jong Il with graceful and beautiful rhythms. 
					
					 Then followed movements such as change of diverse formations, quick surfacing and jumping up.

articles.title: AINDF Members Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
AINDF Members Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front on Tuesday visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 They laid a basket of flowers before the statue and made bows in humble reverence for the President, recollecting his revolutionary life. 
					
					 The chief and members of the mission laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong that day.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Crewmen of foreign ships met at Chongjin Port in North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK on Tuesday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 They were captains and seamen of the Sierra Leonean-flagged ship New Hun Chun and the Tuvaluan-flagged ship Hua JI-6.
					
					 They laid a basket of flowers before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said that the birthday of Kim Jong Il has become a great auspicious event of the world progressives desirous of independence and peace. 
					
					 They noted that under his guidance the Korean people have reliably defended the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation. 
					
					 They praised his Songun politics as the most just mode of politics conducive to global peace and security.
					
					 A letter to the leader was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Singing Gathering Held by Chinese Residents Here
articles.content:
Singing Gathering Held by Chinese Residents Here
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Chinese residents here Tuesday held a singing gathering at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Attending it were officials of the Central Committee of the Association of Chinese Residents in Korea and Chinese residents here.
					
					 The performers sang such songs as "Song of General Kim Jong Il", an immortal revolutionary hymn, and "We Sing of the Party", carrying their deep reverence and trust in Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Planes Carry Gifts to Children on Isolated Islets
articles.content:
Planes Carry Gifts to Children on Isolated Islets
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Airplanes flew to eight isolated islets in the West Sea of Korea Monday, carrying gifts of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the students and children there.
					 They are So, Jamae, Sok, Suun, Rap, Taehwa, Ka and Than Islets.
					
					 Airplanes with gifts on board fly to the islets on the occasion of Kim Jong Il's birthday every year.

articles.title: DPRK Wrapped in Festive Mood
articles.content:
DPRK Wrapped in Festive Mood
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The whole country is pervaded with the great pride and joy of having Kim Jong Il, the Songun brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, on the occasion of his birthday which falls on February 16.
					 Pyongyang is now witnessing the 15th Kimjongilia Festival, national photo exhibition and ten-day film show celebrating his birthday, 20th Paektusan Prize International Figure-skating Festival and other colorful events.
					
					 The venues of the events are pervaded with deep trust in Kim Jong Il who has led the Korean revolution only to victory, true to the will of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The number of visitors to his birthplace in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu is on the increase in this significant February.
					
					 Preparations for performances by the Mansudae Art Troupe, the State Symphony Orchestra and other art troupes in Pyongyang and local areas are making brisk headway.
					
					 Catering centers are ready to serve customers on the holiday.
					
					 Streets and public buildings are festively decorated with lanterns bearing letters "February 16" and "Celebration" and posters, etc.

articles.title: Iranian President on Boosting Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Iranian President on Boosting Friendly Relations with DPRK
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- We warmly congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his birthday and wish him good health and happiness.
					 Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said this when receiving Jo In Chol, DPRK ambassador to his country, on Feb. 10.
					
					 Iran will boost the friendly relations with the DPRK, he said, hoping that the brave and industrious Korean people would register new success in building a rich and prosperous country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by State Merited Chorus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by State Merited Chorus
						
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance given by the State Merited Chorus.
					 He warmly acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the audience and heartily congratulated them who are devoting themselves to the defence of the country and the prosperity of the socialist country, upholding the Songun revolutionary leadership of the party. 
					
					 The chorus's colorful performance included "Glory to Our Great Party," "Snow-covered Birthplace," "Spring Rays of Love" and "Push Back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology."
					
					 Through the performance pervaded with militant spirit, the chorus truthfully represented the undying leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and the iron faith and will of the army and the people to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, following him single-mindedly.
					
					 At the end of the performance he waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience and congratulated the artistes on their successful performance.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the splendid performance pervaded with the faith and will of the DPRK and the revolutionary soldier spirit given by the artistes of the State Merited Chorus. He highly appreciated their success in the presentation and extended thanks to them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that they would conduct dynamic revolutionary performing activities to more powerfully encourage the army and people in the general advance of the Songun revolution.
					
					 Among the audience were senior officials of the party, state and army Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk and Kim Chang Sop, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Myong Guk, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin, and Department Directors of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Italian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Italian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Sergio Mercuri, Italian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday. 
					 Kim had a talk with the ambassador after receiving his credentials.

articles.title: Chinese Minister of Public Security Wraps up His DPRK Visit
articles.content:
Chinese Minister of Public Security Wraps up His DPRK Visit
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of the People's Republic of China and minister of Public Security, and his party flew back home on Tuesday after winding up his visit to the DPRK.
					 During their stay the minister and his party visited President Kim Il Sung's birthplace in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the e-library at Kim Il Sung University and the Korean Revolution Museum and other places.

articles.title: Distance Lectures Brisk
articles.content:
Distance Lectures Brisk
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Working people and school youth and children in the DPRK are becoming increasingly enthusiastic to get distance lectures to acquire new scientific and technological know-how.
					 The number of the applicants for these lectures given from the Grand People's Study House in Pyongyang is on the steady increase.
					
					 The study house gives distance lectures under the real-time conversation system whereby varieties of image, sound and information are provided both ways. It also provides applicants with an opportunity to get those lectures at convenient time.
					
					 The above-said service started in September last year.
					
					 With the number of people getting scientific and technological lectures and new technological information on the steady increase, working people and school youth and children across the country are showing ever-increasing zeal to acquire latest scientific and technological knowledge through distance lectures.
					
					 Lecturers at the study house are doing their best to raise the level of those lectures to meet the need of learners.
					
					 These lectures put main emphasis on giving basic knowledge about the computer application in the past. But from this year lectures will be given on such core basic technology and ultra-modern science and technology as IT, Nano technology and bioengineering as well as on urgent scientific and technological issues arising in the development of the national economy.
					
					 The study house will invite experts in various fields to give lectures. 
					
					 Kim Mi Hyang, a physician of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Hospital, said that she never misses distance lectures given by the study house.
					
					 She said: "It is very good to receive lectures given from far-off Pyongyang, watching the lecturer on display. I feel as if I were dreaming as I can ask the lecturer any question as to whatever I can't understand. "

articles.title: Mt. Paektu Confirmed to Have 216 Peaks
articles.content:
Mt. Paektu Confirmed to Have 216 Peaks
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- Mt. Paektu of Korea has been well known to the world as a famous mountain since long time ago as it has unique and mysterious landscape.
					  But, the question as to how many peaks Mt. Paektu has had remained unanswered.
					
					 It was in 1908 that a mountaineer climbed Mt. Paektu and surveyed it, clarifying that the main peaks of Mt. Paektu totaled just 16.
					
					 From the end of the 1990s, nearly a century from that period, scientists of the DPRK conducted a detailed survey of peaks of Mt. Paektu which led to ascertaining the fact that the mountain has 216 peaks with 20 meters or more in relative height. 
					
					 The number of peaks seems to celebrate February 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, the Korean people are unanimous in saying that he is the man born of heaven, looking up to Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Korean Nation Proud of Its Long-standing Cultural Tradition
articles.content:
Korean Nation Proud of Its Long-standing Cultural Tradition 
						
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation is proud of its ancient history and long-standing cultural tradition. 
					The Korean nation's history spans 5,000 years during which its members have lived with one and the same language in the same territory as a homogenous nation.
					
					 Taedonggang Culture, one of the five cultures of the world, was created by Korean ancestors. 
					
					A lot of historical relics and remains were discovered in the basin of the River Taedong. Among them are those of primitive culture dating back to the Old Stone Age when human beings started their struggle to conquer nature and ancient culture which had developed for more than 5,000 years.
					
					 The discovery of the mausoleum of King Tangun led to ascertaining the historical fact that Korea is a country advanced in human civilization with a long history of 5,000 years in the East and that the Korean nation is a homogeneous one with King Tangun as its founding father.
					
					 It was Koreans who produced metal type, udometer and built turtle-shaped armored ships, etc. and used them for the first time in the world. 
					
					 The South Gate in Kaesong and Yonboksa Bell boast their elegant and majestic style and outstanding architecture and graceful and exquisite metal workmanship.
					
					 Hunminjongum (the Korean script), Koryo celadon and Korean paintings prove the advantages of the national culture. 
					
					 All the Koreans irrespective of age or sex and social status turned out as one to beat back foreign aggressors. This is one of the excellent aspects of the national character formed throughout the history. 
					
					 The Korean people came to have the best national character in the world as they hold in high esteem President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il as the sun of the nation and the outstanding leader of the nation.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Redeem Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Redeem Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- An international holocaust memorial service took place in Poland recently, 66 years since the liberation of the Auschwitz Concentration Camp set up by Nazi Germany in 1940. 
					More than 1,100,000 Jews, Poles and POWs of the former Soviet Union were massacred there.
					
					 The service attended by the presidents of Poland and Germany reflected the requirements of the times that such crime should not be allowed to repeat itself as it was not just a memorial service for the dead but part of the campaign for redressing past crimes. 
					
					 Fascist Germany committed too monstrous crimes against history and humankind in the past to be redeemed. 
					
					 After the Second World War Germany worked hard in various aspects to redeem the past crimes and turn over a new leaf. Germany made a thorough survey of damage done not only to those countries which suffered from it but also to individual organizations and persons. On this basis it took a state measure for reparation while taking criminal actions according to the relevant legal procedures by ferreting out former Nazi war criminals. In this way Germany showed internally and externally its will to break with its past.  
					
					 However, the attitude of Japan, the same war criminal state, was quite different from Germany's behavior. Though more than half a century has passed since its defeat, Japan has not yet admitted of its past crimes. It is so brazen-faced as to distort and justify its past crimes, letting loose sheer sophism that it did not invade Asian countries but "protected" them from aggression by European and U.S. powers and helped Asian countries in the development of civilization. 
					
					 It is shameful for Japan to run the whole gamut of cunning methods to embellish its past crimes and keep them buried into oblivion. 
					
					 The monstrous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists can neither be played down nor written off no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and how frequently an old generation is replaced by a new one. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to pay heed to the warning of the international community that it can never expect better future unless its past crimes are redressed.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Lesson of Broken North-South Military Talks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Lesson of Broken North-South Military Talks
						
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks came to a rupture some time ago. A bitter lesson drawn from the preliminary talks is that no success can be expected from dialogue if a dialogue partner pursues confrontation out of evil will. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on to say:
					
					 The DPRK made every possible effort to realize dialogue and negotiations and the public opinion at home and abroad strongly called for the improvement of the north-south relations. The south Korean authorities came out to the preliminary talks, weighed down by this call. But their real intention was to evade public criticism branding them as a group of traitors going against the requirement of the nation and the trend of the times and press for confrontation policy. 
					
					 When the DPRK took steps for dialogue the south Korean authorities fueled the distrust and confrontation with the north in collusion with foreign forces. 
					
					 This indicates that they treated the DPRK as the confrontation partner, not as the dialogue partner from the outset. The south side deliberately scuttled the north-south dialogue, displeased with it. Naturally no progress was made in the recent military talks. 
					
					 The recent talks clearly showed that only when the south Korean ruling forces drop the policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen and take the stand for the nation is it possible to open a way for improving the north-south relations and achieving independent reunification.

articles.title: Japan's Scheme for Reinvasion Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Scheme for Reinvasion Blasted
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- 4,500 troops of Japan's Ground "Self-Defense Force" and about 1,500 U.S. troops recently staged military exercises simulating a "missile attack on Japan" and guerrilla and all-out warfare on Kyushu Island, Japan.
					 It is also reported that the SDF troops would stage landing and other military exercises in the U.S. Marines base in San Diego, California and other places in February.
					
					 The big military exercises staged by the Japanese reactionaries with the U.S. at the outset of this year clearly show the true nature of the militarist forces engrossed in reinvasion. 
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries claim "ensuring security of Japan" and "coping with missile attack" while talking about "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. This is just a trick to cover up their sinister intention for launching militarist reinvasion and turning Japan into a military giant and rush headlong into the military adventure. 
					
					 Their rhetoric about "ensuring peace" is reversed version of the theory of reinvasion. 
					
					  It is the invariable strategic aim of Japan to realize its militarist ambition with help of the U.S. 
					
					 Korea is the first target of reinvasion by the Japanese militarist forces. They seek to start overseas aggression through reinvasion of Korea and launch conquering Asia and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The frantic moves of the Japanese militarists are rendering the situation in Northeast Asia tenser, increasing the danger of war.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to clearly understand that the anachronistic reinvasion will only lead to their own death and destruction.

articles.title: Scheme for Conclusion of FTA Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scheme for Conclusion of FTA Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- South Koreans from all walks of life protested the puppet authorities for finally signing agreements on the results of the additional negotiations for the conclusion of the "Free Trade Agreement" (FTA). They were reached between south Korea and the U.S. in December last year. 
					 The Headquarters of the All People Movement for Checking the South Korea-U.S. FTA grouping civic and public organizations held a press conference outside the "government" building in Seoul on Feb. 11. It denounced the agreements as drain on resources to the U.S., violation of sovereignty of south Korea and deception.
					
					 The organization strongly urged the authorities to punish the working chief of the negotiations and immediately scrap the humiliating documents.
					
					 A member of the Democratic Labor Party said on the same day that the agreements are null and void as they were signed without the examination of major items.
					
					 The "government", not content with mocking at the people, signed the agreements devoid of examination only to meet international disgrace, he said.
					
					 The Democratic Party said that the agreements would be recorded in the history as humiliation. The party would surely check the treacherous conclusion of FTA together with other opposition parties, it added.

articles.title: Field Tactical Exercises Slated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Field Tactical Exercises Slated in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The 5th infantry division of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage field tactical exercises in Kyonggi Province from Feb. 14, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The exercises are said to last till Feb. 18 with huge troops and offensive war equipment including tanks and armored cars involved. 
					
					 The warmongers' projected frantic war exercises against the DPRK clearly reveal their mean colors as disturber of dialogue.

articles.title: US Faces New Terrorism Threat
articles.content:
US Faces New Terrorism Threat
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- US Secretary of Homeland Security Janet Napolitano said the threat of terrorism against the United States is at its most heightened state since the September 11, 2001 attacks.
					 She said America now faces new threats from groups inspired by Al Qaeda and from so-called "homegrown" terrorists who could already be inside the United States.
					
					 Speaking at a congressional panel, she said, "And in some ways the threat today may be at its most heightened state since the attacks nearly 10 years ago."

articles.title: Japan Criticized for Anti-Russian Campaign
articles.content:
Japan Criticized for Anti-Russian Campaign
 Moscow, February 15 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry recently summoned the minister-councilor of the Japanese embassy in Moscow to protest the anti-Russian campaign in Japan.
					 The Foreign Ministry described the anti-Russian act of Japanese nationalists in Tokyo on Feb. 7 as unforgivable.
					
					 It also informed him of extremists' acts against the Russian embassy and its members in Tokyo.
					
					 Russia strongly urged the Japanese authorities to make investigation into the hostile acts, punish the wrongdoers, ensure regular activities of the Russian embassy in line with international obligations and prevent recurrence of such acts.

articles.title: Mistral-class Vessels to Be Deployed in Pacific Fleet
articles.content:
Mistral-class Vessels to Be Deployed in Pacific Fleet
 Moscow, February 15 (KCNA) -- Russia plans to build Mistral-class vessels and commission them in the Pacific fleet to defend the southern Kurils, said ITAR-TASS. 
					 Quoting a Defense Ministry source on Feb. 9, ITAR-TASS said Russia would allocate a large amount of money to improving the infrastructure of the base of the 18th machine gun and artillery division under the eastern military district on the southern Kurils and replace the division's weapons and other combat equipment with new ones.

articles.title: Chile Declares Agriculture Emergency
articles.content:
Chile Declares Agriculture Emergency
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The Chilean president on Feb. 9 declared an agriculture emergency in central provinces suffering from a severe drought.
					 The president underscored the need to launch efforts for implementing a land management plan and set up an effective weather observation system.
					
					 The Chilean leader also unveiled a plan to build dams for improving the irrigation system in the provinces.

articles.title: Chinese Efforts for Coping with Drought
articles.content:
Chinese Efforts for Coping with Drought
 Beijing, February 15 (KCNA) -- Many areas of China have suffered from a long spell of dry weather. Beijing has had no rainfall and snowfall for 100 days.
					 The ongoing drought is said to be the worst in the country in 60 years.
					
					 Five million hectares of standing crops have been damaged by drought and two thirds of the towns are short of drinking water.
					
					 The Chinese government, as part of an emergency measure, has set up a 24-hour alert system in the drought-stricken areas, dispatched experts to the areas to grasp the damage situation every day and assisted their inhabitants.
					
					 The government is allocating as much as hundreds of millions of US dollars to coping with the drought and laying pipes extending several hundred kilometers to bring water to northern areas from the southern region.
					
					 China will reportedly double the budget for water reserve in ten years.

articles.title: S. Korea's Approach towards Dialogue Proposed by DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea's Approach towards Dialogue Proposed by DPRK under Fire
 Beijing, February 15 (KCNA) -- Wang Linchang, expert on the Korean issue of the Chinese Society for Asia-pacific Studies, contributed an article on the failed north-south military working talks to Huan Qiu Shibao. 
					 The article said:
					
					 One cannot but observe that the north-south military working talks that opened in Panmunjom on Feb. 8 were a great turning point in the efforts of both sides to switch to dialogue from confrontation. 
					
					 These talks, however, failed to narrow down the differences over the "Cheonan" warship incident and the Yonphyong Island incident. The working talks ended up getting familiar with each other's stands, failing to fix the specific date for the next round of talks.
					
					 Shortly ago, there was a reception between media of China and south Korea. On way home, a friend of mine put the following question to me: "At present both the north and the south of Korea call for dialogue. One side asserts unconditional dialogue while the other calls for conditional dialogue. Which side's assertion do you agree with?"
					
					 I told him a story about the contradictions between the two neighbors.
					
					 The two neighbors which were in the harmonious relationship quarreled over the issue of profits. Their trade of bitter accusations led to striking blows at each other. If both of them wish to get reconciled, they should let bygones be bygones.
					
					 The friend had nothing to say.
					
					 Generally speaking, if both sides hold contacts for the high-level military talks and make a switchover to an unconditional contact from conditional dialogue, people will regard this as a positive signal and a development helpful to stabilizing the situation on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					  In order to solve this big problem, there should be great wisdom. There was a precedent in which both sides displayed such great wisdom in settling their relations. 
					
					  The north-south summit clearly showed such high level of wisdom on the part of the two sides.
					
					  Such wisdom finds a vivid expression in the attitudes of both sides looking into the future called national reunification and showing the will for reconciliation and cooperation, putting aside differences before them. 
					
					 The DPRK launched a strong offensive for north-south dialogue. Its government, political parties and public organizations proposed having various talks at an early date on the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang and the Kaesong industrial zone including the talks between authorities. The precondition was "unconditional."
					
					 This term of "unconditional" showed the urgent intention of the DPRK to have dialogue.
					
					 South Korea stood on the defensive, unable to cope with the above-said strong offensive for dialogue, and reacted to it with "conditional" dialogue. Meanwhile, it tried hard to overpower the other side in dialogue by bolstering up the military capability, while paying attention to expanding arms and intensifying military exercises. 
					
					 If the north and the south of Korea treat each other as compatriots, this will bring about a phase of appeasement to bring back or prolong what used to be good in the past under new conditions.

articles.title: Worldwide Moves to Prevent Spread of Foot-and-Mouth Disease
articles.content:
Worldwide Moves to Prevent Spread of Foot-and-Mouth Disease
						
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- FAO in a recent statement warned all Asian countries of the spread of foot-and-mouth disease from south Korea.
					 The speed of the spread of the disease in south Korea is unprecedented since the last five decades, the statement said, warning that the disease may spread to all over Asia in case an exodus and the transport of domestic animals take place in Asia on the occasion of the lunar New Year, in particular.
					
					 The disease occurred in Bahau of Malaysia recently, infecting more than 100 heads of milch cows. An official in the field of stockbreeding of that country said that at least 300 heads of milch cows and goats are presumed to be infected with the disease in the country, adding that the disease is "imported." Earlier, Japan, Mongolia and various other countries disposed of many domestic animals infected with the disease. It was reported that dozens of buffalos were infected with the disease in Zimbabwe, too.
					
					 Steps are now being taken by different countries to prevent the spread of the disease.
					
					 The transport and sale of domestic animals are banned in the afflicted areas and the domestic animals inflicted with the disease are killed and the afflicted areas isolated.
					
					 Hygienic and anti-epidemic works including vaccination are conducted worldwide to prevent the occurrence and spread of the disease.

articles.title: Unreasonable Discrimination against Korean Schools Slammed
articles.content:
Unreasonable Discrimination against Korean Schools Slammed
 Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the hall of the members of the House of Representatives in Tokyo on Feb. 9 to demand an immediate application of the tuition-waiver program to Korean schools in Japan.
					 Present there were dietmen and citizens of Japan, students of Korean schools and their parents and officials concerned.
					
					 The meeting heard reports by representatives of the Forum Peace, Human Rights and Environment of Japan, the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange and the Liaison Society Opposing Exclusion of Korean Schools from Tuition-free Program for Senior High Schools.
					
					 They recalled that the Japanese Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on Feb. 4 expressed its intention not to start the procedure for applying tuition-free program to Korean schools, talking about the Yonphyong Island shelling again.
					
					 Querying why children are to blame for such political and diplomatic issue, they accused the Japanese government of insisting on the discrimination policy under an absurd excuse. 
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers held that Korean students, who are granted national education, should no longer be made to suffer from the unwarranted discrimination policy.
					
					 They said they would continue activities for the settlement of the issue of supporting Korean schools against national chauvinism remaining deep in the Japanese society.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Brazil
Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" was brought out in booklet by the Eco Copia Publishing House of Brazil on February 10.
					 The work, published on March 1, 1993, lays bare the reactionary nature and absurdity of sophism made by the imperialists and renegades of socialism calling socialism "totalitarian," "barracks-like" and "administrative and commanding".
					
					 It also clarifies the principled matters arising in defending and accomplishing the cause of socialism, including the matters of having an unshakable faith in socialism and regarding it as moral duty to defend it and giving full play to its advantages.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe a Meng Jianzhu
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe a Meng Jianzhu
Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio el dia 14 en audiencia a Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado y ministro de Seguridad Publica de la Republica Popular China, y su comitiva que realizan una visita a Corea.
					En la ocasion participaron Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, y Liu Hongcai, embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario chino en Corea.
					
					El visitante chino traslado cortesmente al Dirigente el saludo amable de parte de Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la RPCh, y otros cuadros del partido y el Estado chinos.
					
					Felicito calidamente al estimado Secretario General Kim Jong Il por el cumpleanos y le formulo sinceros votos por la buena salud entregando los regalos preparados por si mismo a el y a             Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC.
					
					Luego de expresar el agradecimiento, el Dirigente reciproco el saludo a Hu Jintao y otros cuadros del partido y el Estado chinos y converso en un ambiente cordial y amistoso con el huesped.
					
					Meng Jianzhu expreso sus calidas felicitaciones por la solucion satisfactoria del problema de secesion de la revolucion coreana gracias a que el Dirigente fue ratificado como Secretario General del PTC y Kim Jong Un fue elegido como vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central en la historica Conferencia del PTC.
					
					Al ver la realidad de Corea, me quede muy impresionado por los sorprendentes exitos que logra el pueblo coreano bajo la direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il, senalo y subrayo que el pueblo chino se alegra mucho de los exitos del hermano pueblo coreano considerandolos como los propios.
					
					Estoy muy complacido de que los funcionarios responsables de fuerzas armadas y seguridad de los dos paises hayan llegado al consenso total tras debatir profundamente unos problemas importantes como mantener y glorificar mas el socialismo, apunto.
					
					El Dirigente evaluo altamente el exito logrado por el ministro chino en su visita a Corea y expreso la esperanza de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran cada dia mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos y los sectores de fuerzas armadas y seguridad de Corea y China.
					
					Terminado el encuentro, el Dirigente ofrecio una cena en honor de los huespedes chinos.
					
					A la recepcion fueron invitados el ministro chino y su comitiva, el embajador y otros miembros de la embajada china en Corea.
					
					Participaron tambien Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC,    Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Ju Sang Song, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Kim Yong Il, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, y otros funcionarios.
					
					La cena transcurrio en un clima ameno y amistoso.

articles.title: Acto central por el 16 de Febrero
articles.content:
Acto central por el 16 de Febrero
Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang el acto central por el dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Al conclave asistieron los cuadros directivos del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, los presidentes de partidos amigos, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, los funcionarios de las instituciones de ciencia, educacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, los familiares de los martires revolucionarios, benemeritos y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los grupos de felicitacion de los coreanos en ultramar, los compatriotas radicados en otros paises y el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang.
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					
					El informante senalo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il nacio en el monte Paektu, sagrado lugar de la revolucion, lo cual fue la maxima fortuna de la nacion que prometio el camino brillante de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y un historico evento mundial que abrio el brillante porvenir de la causa de la independencia de la humanidad, comenzo el informador y prosiguio:
					
					Gracias a tener este dia jubiloso de enaltecer al gran hombre sin par, el pueblo coreano pudo conducir a la victoria la causa revolucionaria del Juche manifestando en plenitud la dignidad y el honor de la nacion de Kim Il Sung que orienta la epoca de la independencia en las severas mareas de la historia con la fortuna de contar de generacion en generacion con los excelentes lideres y generales. 
					
					Hoy dia, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Estado hacen brillar como el partido y el Estado del camarada Kim Il Sung, todo el ejercito y el pueblo estan unidos monoliticamente en torno al partido, el sujeto de la revolucion se fortalecio extraordinariamente y la base politico-ideologica se consolido con firmeza, lo cual es el brillante fruto de la capacidad politica extraordinaria del Dirigente.
					
					Todos los militantes del partido, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular y otros habitantes deben quedar fieles a la unica direccion del Dirigente y materializar cabalmente el legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung para construir integralmente la gran potencia prospera, adelantar la reunificacion de la patria y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					No pueden ser perdonadas jamas las maniobras conflictivas antinacionales y anti-reunificacion de las autoridades surcoreanas que no desean el mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas sino niegan totalmente el dialogo.
					
					Tambien en lo adelante, la RDPC desarrollara las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con los paises, que bajo el ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad, nos tratan amistosamente, y contribuir activamente a verificar la independencia en el mundo.
					
					Por otra parte, se desarrollaron semejantes actos  en todas las provincias, ciudades y distritos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe felicitacion de Umalatova
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe felicitacion de Umalatova
Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio la carta de felicitacion y un cesto de flores que con motivo de su cumpleanos le dirigiera S. Z. Umalatova, presidenta del Partido por la Paz y la Unidad de Rusia.
					Ella los entrego el dia 11 al embajador coreano acreditado en Rusia, Kim Yong Jae.

articles.title: Kimjongilia recibe mejores premios del mundo
articles.content:
Kimjongilia recibe mejores premios del mundo
  Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- Kimjongilia, nacida reflejando la veneracion de la humanidad al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, recibio sucesivamente mejores premios en las exposiciones mundiales. 
					  En la VII Exposicion de Flores de China, efectuada en 2009 en Beijing, recibio el premio de la mejor ponencia y el diploma. En esta ocasion fueron exhibidas las flores de diversas especies de mas de mil 300 entidades de 27 paises y 31 provincias, regiones autonomas y ciudades de China.
					
					  En la Exposicion Mundial de Floricultura de Shenyang de China efectuada desde el 30 de abril hasta finales de octubre de 2006 gano el premio de oro y el diploma. 
					
					  Ademas, en la XII Exposicion Internacional de Flores realizada en mayo de 1991 en Bratislava de ex Checoslovaquia recibio el premio especial y la medalla de oro y en la Exposicion de Flores de Jilin montada en agosto de 1997, el mejor premio.
					
					  Y obtuvo el premio Grand y el diploma en la Exposicion Mundial de Floricultura de Kunming 1999, en que 69 paises y 26 organizaciones internacionales del mundo expusieron flores y plantas de mas de 2 mil 400 especies.

articles.title: Corea emergida en el clima festivo
articles.content:
Corea emergida en el clima festivo
Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- En visperas del dia de natalicio (16 de febrero) del Dirigente?Kim Jong Il, todos los coreanos estan muy orgullosos por contar con este General Insigne del Songun (priorizacion militar) nacido en el monte Paektu.
					Como colofon de festividades, transcurren en esta capital diversas actividades como el XV Festival de Kimjongilias, la exhibicion nacional de fotos, el ciclo de cine y el XX Festival de Patinaje Artistico Internacional por "Premio Paektusan".
					
					En esas ocasiones se expresa el gran respeto al Dirigente quien condujo a la senda de victorias la revolucion coreana en acato al proposito del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					En el significativo mes de febrero, se aumentan los visitantes a la casa natal del Dirigente en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu.
					
					En las entidades artisticas de la capital y las localidades como el Conjunto Artistico Mansudae y la Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional estan en plena marcha los preparativos para las funciones de festejo.
					
					Mientras tanto, los organos de servicios gastronomicos escogen lo mejor de los platos para expenderlo durante la fiesta.
					
					Las calles y edificios publicos estan decorados en colores de fiesta con las lamparillas en que se leen palabras "16 de febrero" y "Festejo" y los afiches.

articles.title: Ahmadinejad aboga por desarrollar relaciones de amistad con Corea
articles.content:
Ahmadinejad aboga por desarrollar relaciones de amistad con Corea
						
Pyongyang, 15 de febrero (ATCC) -- El presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, recibio el dia 10 al embajador coreano acreditado en su pais, Jo In Chol.
					En la ocasion, el felicito calidamente el cumpleanos de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il y le deseo buena salud y felicidad.
					
					Consolidaremos las relaciones de amistad Iran-Corea, preciso y deseo al valiente y laborioso pueblo coreano nuevos exitos en la construccion de una patria prospera.
